data.title: Climate change
data.statement:
The <<Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC)>> has asked you to carry out some analysis on the variation of temperature per month. You are given [[n]] integers that correspond to the average [[temperatures]] during [[n]] <<contiguous months>>. Your task is to find out the number of <<contiguous periods (period = 1 month at least)>> which have their <<maximum temperature greater than or equal to a given integer>> [[threshold]].

Example:
The last season ([[n]] = <<3>> months), the temperatures were <<16, 20 and 19>> respectively. If [[threshold]] = 20, the output must be <<4>>
Explanation: 1st period with [16, 20], 2nd period with [16, 20, 19], 3rd period with [20] and 4th period with [20, 19].
data.stubGenerator:
read N:int
loop N read temperature:int
read threshold:int
write n_warm_contiguous_periods
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> [[n]] the number of successive months during which the average [[temperatures]] where recorded.
<< Next [[n]] lines:>> average [[temperature]] of a month, as integer.
<<Next line:>> the [[threshold]] temperature, as integer.
data.outputDescription: An integer coresponding to the number of contiguous months where the temperature reached or exceeded the [[threshold]] temperature.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

The Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) has asked you to carry out some analysis on the variation of temperature per month. You are given n integers that correspond to the average temperatures during n contiguous months. Your task is to find out the number of contiguous periods (period = 1 month at least) which have their maximum temperature greater than or equal to a given integer threshold.

Example:
The last season (n = 3 months), the temperatures were 16, 20 and 19 respectively. If threshold = 20, the output must be 4
Explanation: 1st period with [16, 20], 2nd period with [16, 20, 19], 3rd period with [20] and 4th period with [20, 19].
Input
Line 1: n the number of successive months during which the average temperatures where recorded.
Next n lines: average temperature of a month, as integer.
Next line: the threshold temperature, as integer.
Output
An integer coresponding to the number of contiguous months where the temperature reached or exceeded the threshold temperature.
Constraints
1<= n <= 24
-50 <= temperatures <= 50
0 < threshold <= 50
Example
Input
3
16
20
19
20
Output
4
